result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J. Winters

records.addlTxt:
from Defendant
Routed to Judge's JA

2:37 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Nicholas J. Winters appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Right to attorney and waiver forms have been filed. Court reviews waiver of attorney form with Def. and Def. advised of rights. State is satisfied. Court finds Def. is entering freely and voluntarily and will allow Def. to represent self. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. Def. waives time limits for P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on October 20, 2022 at 08:45 am.

No contact with Laura Shidell. 
Comply with all conditions of the sex offender registry program.

1:00 PM / Room 203. Defendant Nicholas J. Winters appeared by video, in custody at the Langlade County  Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Court advises Def. of how hearing will proceed. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.. Def. on PO hold. State heard on bond, recommends $5,000 cash with condition no contact with Laura Shidell and comply with sex offender registry program. Def. heard on bond, wants to proceed pro se. Court questions State on procedures if Def. wishes to represent self. Response by State, asks Court to set an adjourned initial appearance but will contact Judge's JA re: request for a hearing to waive attorney. Remarks by the Court, indicates an adjourned initial appearance will be scheduled and that State will contact JA.    Court orders $5,000 cash bond with conditions as requested.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
